bibl.title: People of the Red Sea. Proceedings of Red Sea Project II Held in the British Museum, October 2004
bibl.note: Blemmyan may have been an invention of outsiders as a means to be able to refer to the inhabitants of the area, just as Julius Caesar apparently invented the term 'Belgian'. In 1912 the Belgian politician Jules Destr√©e wrote in a letter to King Albert I 'Sire (...), il n'y a pas de Belges'.
BARNARD Hans, Sire, il n'y a pas de Blemmyes. A Re-Evaluation of Historical and Archaeological Data.

Janet C.M. STARKEY (Ed.), People of the Red Sea. Proceedings of Red Sea Project II Held in the British Museum, October 2004 = Society for Arabian Studies Monographs. 3 = BAR International Series. 1395 (Oxford, 2005) pp. 23-40, tabl., 2 figg., 1 carte.
